about.summary: Decorate functions to make them return enhanced output. The enhanced output consists in an object of type 'chronicle' containing the result of the function applied to its arguments, as well as a log detailing when the function was run, what were its inputs, what were the errors (if the function failed to run) and other useful information. Tools to handle decorated functions are included, such as a forward pipe operator that makes chaining decorated functions possible.

Decorate functions to make them return enhanced output. The enhanced output consists in an object of type 'chronicle' containing the result of the function applied to its arguments, as well as a log detailing when the function was run, what were its inputs, what were the errors (if the function failed to run) and other useful information. Tools to handle decorated functions are included, such as a forward pipe operator that makes chaining decorated functions possible.

name: r-chronicler
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.2.2" %}

{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-chronicler
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/chronicler_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/chronicler/chronicler_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 045d90b80d4bcd73d9818c77003b11593178da863d8e6ce9fa37e51f844d9e08

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]

  host:
    - r-base
    - r-clipr
    - r-diffobj
    - r-dplyr
    - r-maybe
    - r-rlang
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble

  run:
    - r-base
    - r-clipr
    - r-diffobj
    - r-dplyr
    - r-maybe
    - r-rlang
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('chronicler')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('chronicler')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/b-rodrigues/chronicler
  doc_url: https://b-rodrigues.github.io/chronicler/
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  summary: Decorate functions to make them return enhanced output. The enhanced output consists in an object of type 'chronicle' containing the result of the function applied to its arguments, as well as a log detailing when the function was run, what were its inputs, what were the errors (if the function failed to run)
    and other useful information. Tools to handle decorated functions are included, such as a forward pipe operator that makes chaining decorated functions possible.
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - thewchan

# The original CRAN metadata for this package was:

# Description: Decorate functions to make them return enhanced output. The enhanced output consists in an object of type 'chronicle' containing the result of the function applied to its arguments, as well as a log detailing when the function was run, what were its inputs, what were the errors (if the function failed to run) and other useful information. Tools to handle decorated functions are included, such as a forward pipe operator that makes chaining decorated functions possible.
